conclusion: Understanding the problem setup and given values
Block A is on top of block B, and force F is applied to block B
Static friction force on A is limited to 1 N
Gravitational force on A is 10 N
Static friction provides necessary force to accelerate block A
Kinetic friction force on B is 2 N
Net force on B is F - 2 - f_static
For A and B to remain stationary relative to each other, their accelerations must be equal
f_static = m_A * a for block A
Net force on B is F - 2 - m_A * a = m_B * a
f_static must not exceed f_max for A and B to remain stationary relative to each other
Substitute a = (F - 2) / 3 into f_static = m_A * a
